properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow continuing this morning. Snow will taper to flurries by this afternoon. Additional accumulations of generally 2 to 4 cm are expected, with potential for up to 10 cm in areas of heaviest snowfall. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. There may be a significant impact on rush hour traffic in urban areas. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-25T19:59:58-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-25T08:59:58-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3012402225.2019
Area: Woodstock and Carleton County, Stanley - Doaktown - Blackville Area, Campbellton and eastern half of Restigouche County, Grand Falls and Victoria County, Mount Carleton - Renous Highway, Bathurst and Chaleur Region
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Update: High Water Advisory Alert Is Being Issued For The Roseau River From Gardenton To Stuartburn
properties.Summary:
Description: Update: This is a Manitoba Emergency Alert. Manitoba Infrastructure's Hydrologic Forecast Centre has issued a High Water Advisory for the Roseau River from Gardenton to Stuartburn due to expected high flows. If you are in the affected area, be watchful of local waterways as flooding is likely to occur. Do not attempt to cross fast flowing waters or waters of unknown depth. Avoid flooded areas. Follow all directions by the local authorities. Listen for updates and take all necessary precautions to stay safe. Up-to-date information is available at www.gov.mb.ca/flooding and www.manitoba511.ca or stay tuned to local media.
Expires: 2019-11-26T11:30:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization, 2019-11-25T12:56:06-06:00, 2F0618D5-30C7-D5D0-AD63-2C7B7D29D0F7
Area: Roseau River from Gardenton to Stuartburn
properties.Author: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Long duration rainfall expected Total rainfall amounts: 25 to 45 mm. Location: Norman Bay to L'Anse-au-Clair. Time span: tonight through to noon Wednesday. Remarks: While rainfall rates are not forecast to be heavy, significant amounts are still expected due to the long duration. The highest amounts are expected to be between Mary's Harbour and Red Bay. Those travelling between communities should be on the lookout for localized flooding, minor washouts from runoff, and water pooling, especially in areas with higher existing snowpack. Some areas further inland and over higher elevations may also experience accumulating wet snow tonight and Tuesday morning. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-11-26T11:31:03-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-25T19:32:03-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3826978437.2019
Area: Red Bay to L'Anse-au-Clair, Norman Bay to Lodge Bay
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 15 to 25 cm is expected. Periods of heavy snow will continue for Allison Pass today, as northerly flow brings several bands of moisture over the area. Between these bands the snow will taper off. Periods of heavy snow are expected on and off through today and tonight. Local snowfall amounts will vary with the highest amount expected near Allison Pass. 9 cm of snow has fallen at Allison Pass as of 8 am. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-26T08:53:45-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-25T16:54:45-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3550202916.2019
Area: Highway 3 - Hope to Princeton via Allison Pass
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant snowfall for the middle of the week. Significant snowfall amounts and local blowing snow are expected over several regions of Quebec. An intense low pressure system from Colorado will reach Quebec on Wednesday. Snow will begin gradually Wednesday morning over Western Quebec, and will then spread to central regions in the evening. The exact track of this weather system could still change, possibly affecting the type and amounts of precipitation. Accumulating snow may make travelling difficult. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-26T08:52:23-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-25T16:53:23-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1071506696.2019
Area: La Sarre area, Amos area, Lebel-sur-Quévillon area, Senneterre area, Rouyn area, Malartic area, Val d'Or - Louvicourt area, Ville-Marie area, Témiscaming area, Dorval Lodge area, Le Domaine area, Rapides-des-Joachims area, Mont-Laurier area, La Minerve - Rouge River area, Maniwaki - Gracefield area, Papineau-Labelle Reserve area, Saint-Michel-des-Saints area, Saint-Donat - Mont-Tremblant Park area, Louiseville area, Matawin - Mauricie National Park area, Lac-aux-Sables area, Shawinigan area, Sainte-Anne-de-la-Pérade area, Trois-Rivières area, Gouin Reservoir area, Parent area, Lake Bouchette area, La Tuque area
